=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2013/12/13
Average Rating: 4.0
Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Daniel Petrie'], 'Producers': ['David W. Rintels'], 'Starring': ['Jeff Fahey', 'Morgan Freeman', 'Laurie Metcalf'], 'Studio': ['Fisher Klingenstein Films']}
Review Text: This was a very good movie, however I found it a bit slow moving in parts.  The acting was very good and I'm a huge fan of Morgan Freeman.  His part in this movie didn't seem to be awesome; it wasn't him - it was the part!  Not enough punch for me.  He's capable of so much more but the opportunity to give more wasn't there.
Review Title: OK, but I expected more.
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
ER: The Complete Seasons 1-15 [DVD]
Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Boxed Sets, Drama
['ER:The Complete Seasons One-Fifteen (15pk/GFT/DVD)', "ER explores the inner workings of an urban teaching hospital and critical issues faced by the dedicated physicians and staff of its emergency room. The pulse-pounding drama features new challenges each season, from exploring personal problems outside of Chicago's County General Hospital to the political issues being raised inside. Each season features new additions, including chief resident Kerry Weaver, Alex Kingston as British surgeon Elizabeth Corday, Paul McCrane as abrasive Dr. Robert Romano, and Lucy Knight (Kellie Martin), a third-year medical student starting her rotation. It’s always rush hour at Chicago’s County General where every day brings triumphs and losses. As Dr. Greene fights his final battle, his former student, John Carter, must step in as Chief Resident to lead the group of healers. Meanwhile, Kovac’s wild ways begin to affect his job performance, Susan Lewis gets married, and Weaver gets promoted. Plus, Carter and Kovac return from their time in Africa.", ']]>']
{'Genre': 'Drama, Television', 'Format': 'Box set, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, DVD, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Various', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Number Of Discs': '90', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 9.05 Pounds', 'Item model number': '883929221660', 'Director': 'Various', 'Media Format': 'Box set, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, DVD, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Release date': 'September 13, 2011', 'Actors': 'Various', 'Dubbed': 'Portuguese', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Number of discs': '90'}
Loved the show when it was on TV and I still love it.  I am hearing impaired and missed a lot of dialog when it was on so I was looking forward to watching these with the captioning.  Many of the seasons do not have this option.  It's great to watch without commercials!  With so little to watch on TV these days, this has been a real treat for me.  I just wish the captioning wasn't missing on so many seasons.
Captions for Hearing Impaired are missing on some.
{'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Daniel Petrie'], 'Producers': ['David W. Rintels'], 'Starring': ['Jeff Fahey', 'Morgan Freeman', 'Laurie Metcalf'], 'Studio': ['Fisher Klingenstein Films']}
This was a very good movie, however I found it a bit slow moving in parts.  The acting was very good and I'm a huge fan of Morgan Freeman.  His part in this movie didn't seem to be awesome; it wasn't him - it was the part!  Not enough punch for me.  He's capable of so much more but the opportunity to give more wasn't there.
OK, but I expected more.
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preference**: Continues to enjoy drama series, particularly long-running television shows that explore medical and social themes. Recently expressed an interest in films, though still gravitates towards character-driven narratives.
  
- **Format Preference**: Favors DVD boxed sets for comprehensive viewing experiences, especially for iconic series, but has also purchased films that lack adequate subtitle support, highlighting a potential gap in accessibility.

- **Accessibility Needs**: Has a hearing impairment that significantly influences viewing choices. Prefers content that includes captioning and subtitles to enhance understanding and enjoyment.

- **Viewing Habits**: Values commercial-free viewing, indicating a preference for binge-watching and uninterrupted engagement with content. Feedback on recent film purchases suggests that pacing and opportunity for character development are important elements in their viewing experience.

- **Nostalgic Viewer**: Displays a strong emotional connection to past television experiences, indicating that familiarity and nostalgia play a role in their entertainment choices. 

- **Critical Engagement**: Reviews demonstrate constructive feedback about content accessibility and character opportunities, showcasing a keen awareness of the importance of inclusive features and engaging material in media.

Overall, this user remains an avid fan of drama television and films, particularly those featuring strong performances, and maintains specific requirements for accessibility features to enhance their viewing experience.
